SEARCH
Package controller

Class TerminalController

java.lang.Object
controller.TerminalController
All Implemented Interfaces:
BaseController
public class TerminalController extends Object implements BaseController
TerminalController manages the terminal interface in the BPARK system. This controller handles all user interactions occurring at a physical parking terminal, including logging in, dropping off and picking up a vehicle, viewing available spots, and handling forgotten credentials. Core responsibilities include: Managing screen navigation and UI transitions using a stack-based system. Interacting with the server through the ChatClient to perform operations such as login, parking code validation, reservation activation, and data fetching. Supporting both manual login and simulated scanner-based login for testing or automation. Handling password and parking code reset requests via email, including visual feedback in the UI. Displaying available parking spots and providing feedback to users on their actions. This controller uses JavaFX annotations to bind UI components defined in FXML files and integrates with the broader BPARK architecture via the BaseController interface. It also supports both subscriber-side logic (such as drop-off with reservation) and error handling scenarios.

  • Field Details

    • SCAN_LOG_ID

      public static final String SCAN_LOG_ID
      Predefined subscriber ID used for simulating a successful login via scanner. This ID is used in conjunction with SCAN_LOG_PW to simulate a real subscriber when demonstrating scanner-based login at the terminal.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • SCAN_LOG_PW

      public static final String SCAN_LOG_PW
      Predefined subscriber password used for scanner-based login simulation. This password is paired with SCAN_LOG_ID to authenticate a subscriber during simulated scans at the terminal.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

  • Constructor Details

    • TerminalController

      public TerminalController()
      Constructs a new instance of TerminalController and sets it as the singleton instance. This constructor is typically invoked automatically by the JavaFX framework during FXML loading. It allows other parts of the system to access this controller statically using getInstance().

  • Method Details

    • setClient

      public void setClient(ChatClient client)
      Description copied from interface: BaseController
      Injects the ChatClient into the controller after the FXML is loaded.
      Specified by:
      setClient in interface BaseController
      Parameters:
      client - The ChatClient used for server communication..

    • getInstance

      public static TerminalController getInstance()
      Returns the singleton instance of the TerminalController. This method provides global access to the currently loaded controller, enabling other classes (such as the client or main app controller) to call public methods and interact with the terminal UI logic.
      Returns:
      the currently active TerminalController instance, or null if not initialized.

    • handleLoginResponse

      public void handleLoginResponse(String response)
      Handles the login response from the server for the terminal client. If the login is successful ("TERMINAL_LOGIN_SUCCESS"), clears the navigation stack and navigates to the service selection screen. If the login fails, displays an error popup indicating invalid credentials.
      Parameters:
      response - The response string received from the server.

    • handleActiveParkingResponse

      public void handleActiveParkingResponse(String response)
      Processes the server's response regarding active parking. If the subscriber already has an active parking, a popup is shown to notify the user. If there is no active parking, the UI navigates to the dropoff method screen.
      Parameters:
      response - The response string from the server ("HAS ACTIVE PARKING" or "NO ACTIVE PARKING")

    • subscriberNotFoundCase

      public void subscriberNotFoundCase()
      Handles the case where a subscriber was not found during login or scanning. This method resets the currentSubscriber to a default placeholder instance, allowing the system to recover gracefully without leaving an invalid or partial state. Typically used when the scan or login fails and the application needs to discard any previously attempted subscriber data.

    • handleAvailableSpots

      public void handleAvailableSpots(List<String> availableSpots)
      Displays the list of available parking spots in the UI. If no available spots are provided, shows a message indicating no availability. Otherwise, iterates through the list of available spots and displays them in the designated text area.
      Parameters:
      availableSpots - A list of strings representing the available parking spots.

    • showPopup

      public void showPopup(String message)
      Displays a popup window with a custom message. This method creates a non-blocking alert dialog centered on the screen, formats the content to fit nicely with wrapping text, and allows the user to close the popup manually.
      Parameters:
      message - The message string to display inside the popup window.

    • handleSucsessfulParking

      public void handleSucsessfulParking(String parkingCode)
      Handles a successful dropoff operation by displaying a confirmation popup. This method navigates back to the previous screen and shows a popup containing the generated parking code along with instructions for the user regarding possible extension of parking time.
      Parameters:
      parkingCode - The parking code assigned to the active parking session.

    • handleReservationActivationResult

      public void handleReservationActivationResult(String result)
      Handles the result of reservation activation received from the server. This method unifies the UI response into: - Success message for "SUCCESS" result. - Early arrival message for "ARRIVE_EARLY". - General failure message for all other failure scenarios.
      Parameters:
      result - The result string returned from server ("SUCCESS", "ARRIVE_EARLY", "INVALID_CODE", etc.)

    • handlePickupResult

      public void handlePickupResult(String result)
      Handles the result of pickup request received from the server.

      This method parses the server response, extracts the actual result ("SUCCESS" or "FAILURE"), and displays an appropriate user message via popup window.

      - If the pickup was successful, notifies the user that the car is on its way. - If the pickup failed, informs the user that the parking code was incorrect.

      Parameters:
      result - The server response string, expected format: "PICKUP_RESULT|SUCCESS" or "PICKUP_RESULT|FAILURE"

    • handleCarAlreadyParked

      public void handleCarAlreadyParked()
      Handles the scenario where a drop-off attempt is made but the car is already parked. This method is typically called after receiving a response from the server indicating that the subscriber already has an active parking session. It simply navigates the UI back to the previous screen by invoking handleBack().

    • handlePasswordResetResponse

      public void handlePasswordResetResponse(PasswordResetResponse resp)
      Handles the response from the server after a password or parking code reset request. This method updates the appropriate message label in the UI (either for password reset or parking code reset) based on the lastResetType field. It runs the UI update on the JavaFX Application Thread using Platform#runLater(Runnable) to ensure thread safety. If the response indicates success, the label is updated with the success message in green. Otherwise, the label is updated with the error message in red.
      Parameters:
      resp - The PasswordResetResponse object received from the server.
